Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ron V
Reviews.Content: WiFi is not free, beds are hard, room was dingy, breakfast is very basic, and OH, there is no parking. Their website LIES. You have to park at a public parking site nearly half a mile down the street. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly crew and ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: DagSorbo
Reviews.Content: Not far from underground and with what you need nearby. Most of the rooms quiet and with new interior. Absolutely recommended when compared to price and area.

Reviews.Title: “Not Royal”
Reviews.Author: Marinus M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: a *** star royal hotel with * star room. This hotel has not a three star quality, rather a one star quality. The rooms are very small, no beds for average people, very noisy from other rooms above you.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS SMALL, STAFF NOT BOTHERED ABOUT ANY PROBLEMS”
Reviews.Author: Andrew P
Reviews.Content: I booked five rooms arriving on the 26/02/12, two doubles & three twin rooms. We all arrived earls so only one room was ready but that was not a problem. When one couple went to check in to their double they done so no problem but their room was not big enough for a single bed never mind a double bed & the decor was poor. One of the twin rooms also checked in they were happy with their room. The last twin to check in were given key cards for another room & when they walked in there was two gents already in bed, no appoligie was given to either party. I checked into my room very late, In the morning TV would not work, bed was on a slant, room was tired & the shower door only opened slightlly as it hit the sink. We were also woke at 8am by three painters from another country talking very loud with their radio on painting the corridor. I asked them to be quiet & was abbused. when we departed at 10.45am we left the room & the corridor was covered in old sheets being used by the painters. When I tried to complain regarding the shower the front of house manager "Sinan" who spoke broken English told me the sink was a problem & they would have moved me. We were told the hotel was full so where would I have been moved to??? I have since tried to talk to the manager of the hotel but no body is bothered. This hotel is ok if you back-packer but nothing else. I would not advise anyone to use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: trishladish1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is doing some upgrades and has potential. We ended up in a drafty basement room. The staff did bring us a space heater. The beds were on wheels and kept rolling across the floor. The elevator is sketchy. I got stuck for 10 minutes and chided for pushing the alarm. The only redeeming features were the room was clean and the location was decent. All if the staff could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian-Mixa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Eagle hotel from the 17th till the 23rd January and we are very happy with the hotel although there is nothing special about this hotel that I can think of. The service was great from the staff and always helped us when we needed them and also rooms were kept very clean, corridors near the rooms are very narrow and also our room was exactly in front of the lift so you can hear every person going by and also when the lift is being used but still it didn't bother us that much. The room sizes aren't big but its enough for 2 people you just want to shower, sleep and have some area to put the bags and also the rooms are very warm, too warm in our case. The location of this hotel is perfect because it is just 5 mins away from Paddington underground station and also bus and also about 7-10 mins away from Lancaster Gate underground station and bus which is very good to travel as your about only 10 mins away from Oxford Street and near Hyde Park so everything is not that far away. Overall we were happy with our stay and would only wish we were in a better located room but still they did let us check in about 3 hours before so we didn't argue with them... Also the heating of the rooms is too high and the rooms are too warm and hotel was very clean which is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Eagle Hotel Paddington London”
Reviews.Author: Lizswansea
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Royal Eagle Hotel, Paddington London for three nights in January 2012. The purpose of the visit was to attend an opera in Covent Garden. The hotel was ideally situated for Paddington station where our train arrived, only a five minute walk away. The exterior of the hotel was attractive and the staff very accomodating. There are two lifts, the left one tiny barely enough room for two people plus cases and the right lift considerably larger. We had a room on the fourth floor facing the main road. The room was accessed via the lift and up a small flight of stairs. It had recently been decorated so the furniture and bedding was very acceptable. However, the size of the room was an issue. It was really very small, so it was impossible for two people to move around the room at the same time. We had to take it in turns to get ready and keep our cases on top of the wardrobe and under a table.There is a free safe which is a bonus and tea making facilities. The basin in the bathroom was tiny and shower screen on the bath prone to moving. However, all that said for the price a very convenient place to stay and reasonable for the price. EFs across the road good for breakfast, and we had a good curry around the corner from the station (they offer eat as much as you want 12-4). For getting around, we bought zone 1 all day tickets at Â£7 allowing limitless travel on underground and bus in central London, perfect. Plenty of places in Paddington railway station to eat, M & S and Sainsburys if you want more choice than train buffet for snack on way home. All in all a great break!

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, not the best”
Reviews.Author: NtheP
Reviews.Content: I don't know what to make of this hotel. It was clean and comfortable enough but somewhat on the basic side. 1) the room I had (421) was uncarpeted with plank effect veneer chipboard floor. This was chopped quite a lot so looks untidy. 2) because there is no carpet the bed moves very easily. Being a bit of a restless sleeper I found that by morning I had moved across the room and woke up when my pillow fell off the top of the divan (the headboard is attached to the wall) 3) my room overlooked the main road and was only single glazed so quite noisy. 4) I'm not sure the hotel have sussed but analogue tv gets switched off this year and an old 14" CRT tele with just the 5 terrestrial channels is going to be redundant very soon. 5) the whole decor is looking dated and weary. Ok the good points 1) decent, simple to use shower 2) only a 5 minute walk from Paddington station one way and 5 minutes from Lancaster Gate tube the other way so getting around London from here is pretty easy 3) what interaction I had with the staff was ok Overall would I stay here again? Only if I really had to, there are better places around for the same rates. There is nothing majorly wrong with the Royal Eagle but it's not the best in its class.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, terrible conditions.”
Reviews.Author: Ben M
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel you are greeted to a very pleasant - yet highly deceitful - reception. After being given your keys by the staff, you're on your way into a very, very tight elevator. As we reached our rooms, through winding and extremely narrow corridors; we opened the door and were shocked to find our room was extremely small. The bed took up about two-thirds of the room and moving was very awkward. On further inspection; the blanket was dirty, the walls were scratched and messy, the television barely turned on let alone got any form of channel reception. Opening the curtains--well let's just say closing the curtains provided a much better view. As for the bathroom, a small standing shower, a very small toilet and a few soiled towels, to which I wish I was joking about. We decided to give it a night as it was a cheap hotel and perhaps to my naiveness, I thought this was standard for budget hotels in London. The night was terrible. Every hour you'd hear doors slamming, people laughing outside through the paper thin doors with no form of noise isolation at all. In the morning, my FiancÃ©e and I awoke-- grumpy with barely a few hours of sleep. I was furious and decided to go downstairs to the reception and complain. I approached one of three people at reception and quite angrily said that "I'd like to make a complaint about my room". I was told to "wait please", which is possibly the worst thing you should say to a complaining visitor. I wouldn't have minded as much if not for the fact that there were two other staff members just standing behind her giggling like jackals and seemingly --albeit unlikely-- surprised that I was complaining. Eventually, after about 5 minutes -- in addition to my fiancÃ©e beginning to cry at the entire situation -- another staff member asked us what was wrong. I described our stay, our room, and indicated that I had taken pictures of the insulting standards. I was told that they would upgrade us free of charge. A ray of light, perhaps. But then you have to ask yourself; should I really be thankful that they're upgrading me to a habitable room when we had paid over Â£250 for the pleasure? If, like me, you're planning a trip to London with a loved one, and you don't want to have to go through this hassle -- then please steer clear of this god-forsaken hotel. The staff are unenthusiastic, rude and just plain apathetic towards everything. The rooms are terrible and a big middle finger to naive holiday-makers. The only redeeming feature is the amazing proximity to Paddington Station. I hope this helps you decide to steer clear and if any staff member or anyone in charge of this hotel ever reads this - please raise your standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: dannhck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you won't be in the room to much and or if you need somewhere to stay after a day in London. Well presented hotel, very clean rooms which is most important, good price. Only negative was breakfast if it's included skip it and head to a cafe. Croissants and toast only, and stay well clear of the orange juice not good. Overall happy with are triple room and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to...”
Reviews.Author: shoegirla
Reviews.Content: Booked twin room with a friend, got a room with three beds squeezed in, very narrow. The shower was worst shower ever, no way to get a normal temperature of water, either very cold or very hot. The window couldn't be properly closed, so it got quite cold in the evening.The only good thing about this hotel is it's vicinity to everywhere. Paddington tube is just 5 minutes away. Don't think I'd be staying at that hotel again though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Gyp_the_Cat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel mid-week while we went to the Christmas market in Hyde Park. There were 5 of us including a 2 year old. I know there has been some negative reviews on here and other sites, yet I would like to point out the following: - We were on a budget and for a budget hotel The Royal Eagle was excellent - Come on people, you get what you pay for, if you want 5* luxury book a 5* hotel - How much time will you really spend in your hotel room? The rooms were more than comfortable and warm. A perfect place to sleep after a busy day shopping and seeing the sites. The bathroom was more than acceptable and we all had nice showers. The hotel itself was well presented and clean. It was also centrally located and in a nice neighbourhood nearby were cafes and pubs. All the staff we came across we found to be polite and accommodating. We had a triple room that was great. The double room was more than comfortable. If I was travelling for business and had some work to do in the double room it would have felt a bit on the small side. But again, I'll recap we got what we paid for and our entire party was more than happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Royal review”
Reviews.Author: Andydiff
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel for an Xmas shopping trip at the start of December and was very happy with our stay. The room was very fresh and well decorated and very clean, the bathroom felt modern and well equipped. The only point I would make to fellow travellers is that the room was very small (or cosy as my better half said), but when you are only using the room to sleep in, what the heck! The hotel location is spot on being just a few yards from Paddington station / underground with a good selection of pubs / restaurants in the area. At a price of Â£160 for two nights in London I believe it was excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in safe London neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ttot11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location in a safe neighborhood on a street with a number of other hotels. The price was reasonable in comparison to other hotels in London. London is a very expensive city and the exchange rate is brutal for American. The street outside our hotel was quiet at night and close to a major Underground station, easily accessible to Heathrow Airport. The room was a decent size with comfortable beds and pillows and a small TV. It was basic but good for the typical traveler that spends most of the time seeing the sights around the city, coming back only to shower and sleep a few hours. Nice full bathrooms in the rooms. Breakfast and internet was an additional cost. I would recommend this hotel to others on a budget, including families, and I will stay here again when I return to London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Size”
Reviews.Author: janetlhoo
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed here during a vacation to London. When traveling the most important feature is location and this hotel has it. Only a five minute walk from London's Paddington station makes it easy to get anywhere in England. High speed trains run directly from the airport, the rail runs to the outer cities such as Windsor and the tube runs to all major stops in the city. Having traveled to Europe in the past, I did not have high expectations in terms of room size but I was shocked. We booked a quad room since we were traveling with two children ages 9 and 11. The room was large with a queen bed, a desk, a closet and a balcony. The bathroom was full size with a full size tub. The best part was the upstairs loft which included two twin beds and a nightstand in the middle. The room was large enough to fit my entire family with no problem. The hotel was clean and offered complementary breakfast (bakes goods, cereal, juice, etc). The hallways are small and the carpets in the hall are older as the building is older but I most of London is like this. The room was much nicer than the hallway. Price was reasonable. Overall this hotel is a great value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with average rooms”
Reviews.Author: CragCaveMan
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in the hotel during WTM in early Nov knowing room rates would be high. The Royle Eagle was available and even though the rate is high is in a good location for transport and services. The rate was over Â£200 for 2 nights with no breakfast. For that price it should have included even continental! Rooms are average, very clean and well maintained but minimal in their facilities. My rooms was split level with a winding stair case to the bedroom. Bathrooms downstairs, not ideal for large luggage or people with mobility issues. A lot of the rooms towards the front of the hotel seem to be like this. The receptionist described it as an 'upgrade'.......hmmm. Overall the hotel is average, not extra services like room service but clean and well located.

Reviews.Title: “nice and good location”
Reviews.Author: yoel1
Reviews.Content: It is a very good location near to Paddington. Courteous service at reception and we had a spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “bad front office”
Reviews.Author: sharkyja
Reviews.Content: noting to say, if front office staff does not hav eservice mind. Bad express, no freindly. nothing to impress. room is also nothing, small, not clean enough for 3 star. Can not leave the luggage at front office before check in time or after check out! so poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Noisy Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Jared B
Reviews.Content: The windows are old and don't do a very good job of blocking out street noise. Also, was abruptly woken up at 7 AM by a garbage truck slamming down a large trash collector, 50 feet from my window. The hotel's idea of "air conditioning" is a table top fan. Wireless that I paid for didn't work in my room so I was unable to do any work. Bed and pillows were uncomfortable as well. I left this hotel after one night and found a much better hotel for slightly more money. The only positive thing this hotel has going for it is its location. It is located in central London, and close to the underground. However I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “for Â£110 I expect hot water and luggage storage.”
Reviews.Author: HAB59
Reviews.Content: The morning shower was cold. When we enquired we were informed that the boiler was not big enough for the number of rooms and we should try again in a couple of hours. The next morning we got up specially early hoping for a hot shower but once again it was tepid at best. We had been traveling for a month so we each had a bag. We arrived in London at 1pm. There is no parking or lay by near by so we doubleparked and took the bags in. Could they please hold them till our room was ready? The answer an emphatic No. What did they suggest we did? Come back in an hour. The room was a shoe box and bore no resemblance to the photo on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Central and comfortable hotel, perfect for tourists”
Reviews.Author: StockholmBean
Reviews.Content: But hey, we're writing 2011 - wifi should be just as complimentary as the pillow. Â£5 per hour when the current price is Â£3.25 per month !?

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, uncomfortable, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: nikkilou1969
Reviews.Content: I was visiting with my young daughter and chose this hotel due to it being near an underground station and convenient for where we needed to go. Thats the good points out of the way. We did not sleep a wink and that is not an exaggeration. We were in a tiny tiny room downstairs next to the staff room and a very noisy door that slammed every time a staff member went through it, shaking the whole room. The staff chatted and laughed all night long and even stood outside my door and shouted to each other. On a number of occasions I asked them to be quiet which they did for about 15 mins then it started again. I asked to be moved which they refused to do. I tried to put something in the noisy door to make it close more quietly but it was such a heavy door with no slow-close nothing worked. In the morning a groggy me and grumpy 9 year old went down for breakfast. Im milk intolerant and asked for eggs. The waiter didnt understand me and kept telling me I needed to have cereal. I saw other people had eggs but he was having none of it. We left and told reception about our stay. The receptionist apologised and said there was nothing he could do. A complaint to the hotel has since produce a 10% voucher off my next stay. Ive refused it and asked for a refund which they have refused. Great customer service, eh?????!!!!.............hmmmmmmmmmmmm AVOID!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely NOT be back!”
Reviews.Author: Sotiaki
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room for me and my parents. We were given a tiny two-story room with narrow stairs to get on the upper level. The double bed was on the second floor, behind a pillar and the ceiling was very low. For my middle-aged parents it was impossible to carry their luggage up there or sleep in this claustrophobic place. There was not enough room to even open our luggage and we just couldn't wait to leave! The sink was dirty and water stagnated in it. It was disgusting! If this is not enough, how about this... The room was on the second floor of the hotel, but after getting off the lift, you had to walk through narrow corridors, open several doors on the way, and even go up and down intermediate staircases!! And all these while carrying your luggage! I definitely do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone, unless you are really lucky to get a single-story room with a front view, next to the lift. Plus, the woman at the reception was sooo rude!!

Reviews.Title: “Such small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SueS0
Reviews.Content: Great location. Hotel generally clean and tidy but room110 is so small, the shower miniscule so we asked to change, staff relatively helpful but moved us to a room only very slightly bigger that hadn't been refurbished(but we could actually open the wardrobe doors!) the bathroom ceiling was a bit mouldy but on the whole clean and presentable. Can't leave luggage anywhere and don't have "breakfast"

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you have very low expectations”
Reviews.Author: Vqzqob
Reviews.Content: If you want only a cheap, small, noisy, and clean room near an Underground station, then you will not be disappointed. Do not stay here if you expect anything else. Our room was very noisy (both street noise and the rumbling of passing underground trains). Since the rooms are not air conditioned, you will have to open the windows in the summer, which makes the noise worse. Had a complementary breakfast with our room but meal very poor and we were constantly harassed by the staff to show our breakfast ticket. The business model of the hotel seems to be to do the absolute minimum needed for your money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: lizzy089
Reviews.Content: excellent value for a one night stay in London- we benefited from an online discount of 67%. So close to Paddington station and tube. Walking distance through Hyde Park to Oxford Street. The service at all times was very friendly and helpful. Our twin room was very small but more than adequate for a short stay. Room was very clean and modern with modern bathroom. We were also able to take a later check out so we could go sightseeing without our cases! We were told it could be noisey from the tube/train station - but it was minimal (on the 5th floor!).

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: lottie1979
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is great. Very close to the station of paddington station, bars, restaurants and shops. I had read all the bad reviews and was worried about staying here. However I did not find the previous reviews to be true. The only thing I found was that the hotel is extremey hot and noisy. I found my room to be clean and tidy and it had recently been refurbished with all new bathroom and bedroom. The room was massive with flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Niki4r
Reviews.Content: After seeing the pictures on the website we booked a twin room and were very disappointed to find the room was tiny. There were 2 single beds, a desk with a little kettle and tea/ coffee etc. a tiny portable tv (not flatscreen wall mounted like the pictures) and a wardrobe with 5 hangers (one broken) and chair. There was literally only enough room to walk between the beds and to the wardrobe. The bathroom was worse. Im only 5ft but when I reached to wash my hair in the shower I was elbowing the wall. Paint peeling along the window, and due to the fact there was no extractor fan we had to open the window (which faces the main road) when we wanted to shower. It was also very warm at night, and quite noisy even with the windows closed, so we didn't want to open them (did'nt get any sleep anyway!) The reception area was nice enough, and the 'resturant' was ok, just a bit small. 2 lifts, athough only one of them goes to the top floor. The only reason I've given this 2 stars instead of 1 is that it has a convienient location (5 min walk from paddington station) and it was fairly cheap - we paid Â£67 for 1 night. Overall I would say I'm glad we weren't staying more than one night, and that we didn't spend very much itme in the room. I wouldn't stay here again, and if you are planning to I suggest getting a bigger room than you actually require.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: expats31
Reviews.Content: We arrived early evening to find they had no record of our booking despite having prepaid several months ago. After waiting for over a hour in the lobby with our two small children they said they had no record of our booking and no rooms available. We quickly made other arrangements and booked a taxi to the nearest Marriott. When asked for written confirmation that they had no rooms they suddenly turned round and said they had found our booking (after already confirming the reservation with the other hotel !). The staff were rude and unfriendly and this was not the start we wanted for our family weekend in London

Reviews.Title: “Small and claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: Elachristina
Reviews.Content: Clean, but small and claustrophobic. Small room, bathroom, elevator, corridors, all are very small. Breakfast: bread, jam and cereal; no meat or cheese. No place for storing lugage. Very nice Indian restaurant close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed with this Hotel, Very Clean & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Bobbett
Reviews.Content: Having stayed 2 days at the worst hotel in my life (Hillindon Lodge) we then moved to this hotel " The Royal Eagle" and was very impressed, having read other reviews about small rooms we booked a tripple room for just the two of us and was well pleased, The room was large and very clean the bathroom was quite big with a shower over the bath (which i prefer) and the beds had clean sheets and were very comfortible, The only down side was that the room was very very hot, i checked the radiators but they were off, we had to sleep with the windows open and could hear the noise of the traffic in the night,, The location is fantastic as its about a five minuite walk to paddington train station overall we had a fantastic weekend in London as we got promotion to the premier league (Swansea City) and stayed in a Great Hotel, Will definitely be staying at this hotel again when we visit Fulham, Chelsea, QPR, Arsenal, Tottenham in the coming season

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location; clean.”
Reviews.Author: aaalien
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was nice. Got directions from the security guy, who was very nice and helpful. Forgot the cell phone at the hotel (left it plain sight) leaving for the day, and when we got back it was still there (and the room was clean). Thanks cleaning ladies! The rooms where very clean and so was the bathroom (with bathtub and shower), which seems to have been renewed short time ago. Rooms and corridors are a bit claustrophobic and do not match the HotelÂ´s lobby and exterior. We were lucky though: we booked a double and got a triple (paid the same). Awesome location! A 2 minutes walk will get you to Paddington Station. In the surroundings, you have 2 or 3 italian restaurants and a few other restaurants, all nice and not too expensive (had a meal at one of them for Â£10/each). The noise from the outside was considerable, in the morning. All in all, itÂ´s a good place if you get it for Â£75 or under. For more than that, I would look for something else. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: jarsil808
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks very nice from the outside. And the reception is very nice and weloming. The rooms are in need of some maintanance. Our room had a strange poorly laid floor tha that was very bumpy. The shower was not properly attached to the wall and pretty much everything was a bit loose. The water boiler cord was no long enough so we had to have it on a chair near the outlet when we made tea, The tv had only few channels with poor image quality. Otherwise a nice hotel with good service and cleaning. Good location near Paddington. Not possible to store luggaga was another downside.

Reviews.Title: “Explore other options. trust me.”
Reviews.Author: leonor123
Reviews.Content: They don't have luggage storage, so if your early and the weather is frozen as per usual > you have to sit in the Cafe with in my case. 6 luggage's! Small elevator so you may find yourself waiting for the lift more than other hotels. It's in an alright/average location because it's next to Paddington but more central locations would be much more beneficial and as for service and rooms it's average, nothing special. The water was so hot though, luckily, otherwise I would of changed hotels straight away! It was that cold outside, needed a burning shower. There is better hotels out there in London for a better price

Reviews.Title: “Definetly FALSE advertisement”
Reviews.Author: portstlucie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through a Travel Agency. Paid extra for breakfast service which WAS NOT included per/receptionist, also had an optional fee to pay to have my bags held at the hotel, since check-in was at 2pm...FALSE, they did not take my bags even thou proof of a baggage fee receipt was provided! Rooms very small, NOT what was shown at the travel agency. 1st room I viewed had mold spots EVERYWHERE in the bathroom (NOT GOOD), 2nd room was a bit more decent but the windows were extremley dirty! Really upset with the whole situation, but didn't want my 13yr old to see that, since this was a mommy and son trip to London where he has dreamt about visiting, We just made the best of it! T.V 3 channels and one was repeated 5 other times! Thin walls, so We heard our neighbors snoring! Location Excellent, Staff not so friendly and anti-social...So Good Luck getting any information from them!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristinasr
Reviews.Content: The service was not good. The personal in the reception were not very customer-friendly. It looked to me as if they could, the would rather do nothing. The room we got, was very small, but the beds were okey, not the greatest but absolutely bearables. The corridor into the rooms was very smalltwo normal adults couldn't walk side by side. The bathroom was also very small, i got a picture of it downunder. Although the hotel was small, was it localed great. It took about 10-15 min. to walk to Oxford street.(The personal told us that you couldn't walk, it was to fare, you HAD to take a taxi). Not the best hotel I have visited in London, but ok standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NinaSilva
Reviews.Content: The room was to small, very noise (inside and outside noise), the breakfast was very poor, only butter and bread, no cheese or hum. The service was also bad. Most employees weren't nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Rooms! Reception misleading to standard of rest of hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisalynne123
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here as a matter of we had to, having induced two whole days of disruption at heathrow we thought staying near the heathrow express train in paddington would be best. This was one of the only hotels avaliable at the time. Upon walking into the reception area of the hotel i was quite happy, shiny floors spacious areas, sofas, large front desk, little did i know that this was where all the good points ended! We were given a room which had two twin beds. We didn't know this when booking as the receptionist didn't speak very clear english at all. The room was unbelievably cold and had the smallest tv ever! After asking repeatedly for someone to come fix the radiator we were moved to another room instead. I thought it can't get much worse than this can it? Well we opened the door to be greeted with a rusty, rickety, narrow spiral staircase which went up to a mezzanine floor where our bed was. There was no room to get up and down either side of the bed, i couldn't believe it! As well as having such poor rooms at this place we knew we were paying over the odds as we had stayed in the hilton hotel at heathrow a couple of night before for Â£10 cheaper! We wish that we could have got in there for a 2nd night. I will definitely not be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst beds ever”
Reviews.Author: kiwi249
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with two friends back in August for two nights and from first appearances the room looked nice and the location was good. The beds, however were the worst I have ever experienced and after travelling around Europe for 6 weeks, they still take #1 in the most uncomfortable. The only reason I got any sleep the first night through being jabbed by springs every time you rolled over was due to jetlag! On the second night we went down to reception and asked if they had any spare blankets (to pad up the beds) and they had ONE. We were told by the staff that the hotel was full and this was the reason they had no blankets. Very surprising that they have none spare at all, wonder what they do in winter? Definitely wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel and probably wouldâ€™ve slept on the floor if it was carpeted!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs all over the hotel”
Reviews.Author: david1690
Reviews.Content: This is nice looking hotel on the exterior and interior decor - even teh rooms look clean but it invested with bedbugs - in every room - behind headboards, under mattresses - it is a nightmare. We came out with welts from bites all over our bodies. The staff are clueless - half cant speak english properly and they grunt when asked questions. - stay clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Bodget not Budget!!”
Reviews.Author: scousewillie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible - room was tiny and hot - drains in the bathroom smelt terribly. 1 TV channel on old,small portable tv. No plug for sink which was full of previous occupants soap - shower had no cover to plug hole so soap kept going down the drain. Electric sockets hanging off the wall and dangerous. Outside and reception looks ok but don't be fooled - reception staff not overly friendly either. I certainly wasn't meant to feel very special that's for sure! Will give this place a wide berth in future - there are plenty of better hotels and apartments closeby if you want to stay in Paddington. I feel embarrassed to think foreign visitors come to the uk and experience places like this.

Reviews.Title: “The terrible smell in the bathroom....”
Reviews.Author: TshepisoKN
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews took a chance and regretted it!!! I was travelling with my mother and we stayed at the hotel for three nights. Check in was fine even though when I checked out I forgot my 20 pounds deposit and none of the staff members reminded me. The first night there was a terrible smell in the bathroom, because we were tired we had to live with it. The following morning we reported it and they said they will change our room when we come back. When we came back there smell was gone. I think they have rat problems because there was a strange whole underneath the bath and they were not amazed when we told them about the smell. The third night the smell was back but because we were leaving the following morning we again had to live with it. The rooms are very very small. The breakfast is just bread, ceral and tea don't expect anything more. It is close to Paddington train station which connects to the majority of places. I won't recommend this hotel to anyone even backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: aubreymead
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 22nd September for 2 nights I stayed in room 519 and on my second night woke up to find the room infested in bed bugs. Went to reception and was given another room 506. The hotel looked really nice and had good reviews. My arms, neck and face are covered in spots which a very itchy. I also caught 2 in a glass and showed reception which is how I found out they were bed bugs. I had to unpack my case outside my home for fear of infesting my home

Reviews.Title: “Look around - better options should be available”
Reviews.Author: Eric-Antje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during our London visit. As we spent most of our time outside, hotel is not that important. But I don't think you should expect a room. This was by far the most cramped "room" that we experienced (including very low budget latin american hotels). It wasn't even possible to walk around the bed. to the other side. You had to crawl over as a (small) desk was in the way. Price / quality ratio was, according to us, very bad. London itself was a big succes. We will most likely visit again.....but won't be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed over one night after Kings Of Leon Gig on 30th June 2010”
Reviews.Author: kingsofleonAyrshire
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 12ish hoping staff would let us leave luggage, we had travelled overnight on a bus from Glasgow, we were really tired and hot, desperate for a shower. Eventually the room was ready at 1pm and they let us in....only to find there were no windows that could open, no air conditioning (there was a fan in the cupboard) and worst of all there was no water!!! We were given room G08 so beware travellers....maybe they had better rooms, but I will never find that out.

Reviews.Title: “worst room of our 15 day trip to UK”
Reviews.Author: ach2004
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews, we took a chance and lost. It was out last night in the UK, and our worst room (with one of the highest fees). No breakfast, most cramped, and not entirely clean. No air conditioning. We did have hugh french doors, but couldn't keep them open for the breeze, because they were on a shared balcony. We did not feel least bit comfortable. Luckily we were catching a train at noon the next day, because we would not have had anyplace to store luggage if we had needed to. WOULD DISSUADE you from booking. We've stayed at much friendlier, cleanier places in London for less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel next to Paddington station”
Reviews.Author: Glampod
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked a room for 3 over the internet at a decent rate. Upon arrival, we were told the room was not yet ready (it was noon, check in is at 2) and the hotel couldnt store our luggage. We decided then to grab something to eat as there are some pubs and fast-foods in the area. We came back in time for check-in and we told we were given a room for 5 (room 219). The room was on the second floor and was quite big. There was a mezzazine with a double and single beds and 2 singles bed downstairs where the bathroom was. There were also 2 big windows and a terrasse but overall it was quite quiet. As for the location, paddington, bayswater and lancaster gate are within walking distance. There is not much in the area but it is very close to Hyde park and with the tube nearby it is easy to move around. I had read reviews before and i was a bit anxious but the experience turned out to be very comfortable. Check-in and check-out were very easy and the room we had was very big for 3. The main issue is the lack of luggage room but as we were only there for a night it was not a big problem. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a decent accomodation in a quiet area. We ended up walking a lot but, from hyde park to notthing hill but it was very pleasant as the weather was summery.

Reviews.Title: “No service available”
Reviews.Author: danish60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Royal Eagle 2 nights in February 2010 and experienced lack of service. 1) Arriving early we tried to put our luggage at the hotel, but was informed that it was not possible. When we left we asked to have extended check-out time to avoid bringing the luggage to a railroad station. When we collected our luggage the entrance hall was filled with luggage from other people who was allowed to leave their luggage. We even learned that some people could place their luggage in a locked room. 2) The toilet had a BAD smell of sewer. We informed about the problem at the reception, who promised to do something about it, at least the next day. Nothing had happend when we returned the same evening. The next day we left the hotel hoping that a solution was found. When returning around mid-night we found the door to the toilet open as well as the window (0 Â°C outside) since roomservice sometime during the morning - the beds was litteraly frozen! We got a new room in the middle of the night, but there was no help to move our luggage. 3) The breakfast do not include anything else to put on the bread than marmelade, but you can buy (in the reception, not the restaurent) a ticket for ham and cheese. This would cost you Â£ 7. Now I understood why many people carried their own ham and cheese to the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CNE-Bergen Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: We got a very small room. But the day after we were aloud to upgrade to a bigger room. The bed was very hard. And to breakfast they only had bread, jam and cereal. And the day we left we wasn't aloud to leave our storage at the hotel. Very bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and nice. good location”
Reviews.Author: FloridianinLondon
Reviews.Content: We went to London at the beggining of October 2009, I was scared a little bit from reading the reviews so asked to check the room first before moving our luggage in. Andrew at the front desk was very accomodating and nice. He let me look to a few rooms. I selected a twin bed room instead of a double bed room because it was a little bit bigger. The room was on the 3rd floor and was very quiet. The bathroom was very nice and clean. However if you have a lot of luggage and stuff, this is not the place for you. We were travelling from Paris and to the country side and the fact that it was so close to the train station was a big plus. Royal Eagle is located two blocks from Paddington and near many restaurants, most of them fast food ones. We tried "Spices of India" that is almost next door to the hotel. It was an excellent choice!! Loved it!!! I recommend the coconut bread and everything Tandoori. If I go back to London will probably stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: HHAndersen
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - but very small rooms. No place for storing lugage. Continental breakfast possible. Placement is perfect - close to Paddington station with no less than 4 metrolines and public trains. Very short walk to Hyde Park , lots of small restarents and finnaly a very nice pub just next door The Pride of Paddington

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: AnglophileBoston
Reviews.Content: We arrived this hotel in the early evening after many travel delays to an indifferent reception. After dinner at a nearby restaurant and returned to our room late in the evening, only to find that the sheets had not been changed since the previous guests occupancy. We called the desk and asked if clean sheets could simply be provided and we would change the beds ourselves. They said no, would have to change rooms. So we schlepped our suitcases down five floors including a flight of stairs to a new room which was freezing and where were awoken at 5:30 AM to the sounds of many trash cans being emptied. We were then informed that the room was scheduled for renovations and would have to move again. The breakfast was especially disappointing. Bread bread and more bread. No full English breakfast here. The coffee is instant, the hot water isn't hot. Three televisions drown out conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Barely sufficient”
Reviews.Author: 20CreekFarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed free at this hotel for three nights with credit card points, and while it wasn't terrible, I'm glad we weren't paying for the room. Counter to the other reviews, our room was reasonably large, perhaps because it was a quad (room G07). But, the room was hot even with the heat turned off (and on the ground floor), the beds a bit lumpy but serviceable. Most disturbing though, was a problem with the door, which would open of its own accord if not bolted, even if the door was closed sufficiently. Perhaps something to do with an airlock created when a train passed underneath?? We forgot to bolt the door the first night, and it opened in the middle of the night. Imagine our surprise to wake up the next morning with the door wide open. The shower had a clog and would overflow if you kept it running longer than a minute or two. Breakfast was not very good, just cereal and breads, with no option for a full breakfast, and the breakfast room not big enough to accomodate all the guests...always a line, sometimes quite long. One morning we opted to skip the long line and have breakfast at a pub down the road. On the upside, the hotel is well located and affordable, for those paying. It's clean, and the staff was pleasant and seemed to be doing the best with what they had to work with. Again, it wasn't terrible, but I doubt I would stay there again given the opportunity, even as a freebie.

Reviews.Title: “Beleive me, this is cheap, smelly and noisy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evgenialen
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but the hotel is in the old building with very small rooms and its noisy and stressing to stay there. Avoid it if you have Plan "B".

Reviews.Title: “avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: LondonMissB
Reviews.Content: I was meant to be staying at the Shaftesbury Premier London Hyde Park and having booked a deluxe double room, I arrived just after 11pm to be told that due to maintenance issues I wasnâ€™t able to stay at the hotel and I had to stay at another hotel round the corner â€“ the Royal Eagle. This was incredibly frustrating but was made even worse by the fact that the Royal Eagle is one of the worst hotels I have EVER stayed in and could in no way be consider to be a 4* hotel (which is what the Shaftesbury Premier London Hyde Park claims to be) and my room was anything but a deluxe double room. On arrival, a couple were complaining about the room they had been given but were told it was all they had. I then checked in and was given a triple room which I think most people would take issue with. It was right by the road and the traffic noise was terrible not helped by it being on the ground floor. Worst still the lock on the door didnâ€™t even work. I donâ€™t think anyone would consider this to be acceptable â€“ and definitely not a woman staying on her own. I went to reception to request another room which I was given without any question â€“ he clearly knew it was a poor room. My next room was slightly better in that it was on the third floor and not on the road side. However the room was far from â€œdeluxeâ€�. It had a bed with a sheet on it and a cupboard which you could only open if you moved half the furniture around. The bathroom was poorly maintained and the shower blocked causing flooding which meant you had to keep turning it off to allow the water to drain. If it had not been so late I would have found alternative accommodation but given that it was late and I was a woman on my own I did not want to have to do this. Given the previous room, by this stage I was just glad of a room with a bed and a door that locked. The sound proofing is bad in that you can hear the person above constantly thumping around. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Varies greatly in quality”
Reviews.Author: microsciences
Reviews.Content: Came here with my wife as a combined business and pleasure trip. While the Hotel has its location as a big plus, the rest of it is highly variable. My impression is that ALL the rooms are small; figure 10ftx10ft at best. We went thru 3 rooms within the first 2 hrs there. I purposely requested and booked a room with a double bed. Got a room with twins and an extra guest- a mouse. In addition the toilet didn't work. Changed to another room, this one with double bed (we were told initially that none were availabel when we got there ), but a bathroom smaller than the one on my sailboat. No towel racks, non working TV. Our third room, pretty much made it. Still very small and back to the twin beds, but the Bath was a good size, with a full tube and shower, towel racks, a working toilet, and a mostly working TV. Continental Breakfast was in line with my expectations, and the hotel lobby was a comfortable place to work with free internet access on a computer. Wireless is available but costs about 10 pds /day. The Staff is uniformly polite and try to accommodate you. Over the years I've come to have low expectations of hotels in London unless they are part of a large international chain, i.e. Hilton, Raddison, and the like. Unfortunately it is sometimes difficult to get a decent room easily for less than $250/night. My advice for here would be it's reasonable in price, clean ( excepting the the mouse, but I've had that at 5 star resorts as well ) and safe. As long as you realize that your room is only used minimally, you're ok. It's location, a 2 minute walk to Paddington Station, and 10 minute walk to Kensington and Hyde Park is its best recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Glad we didnt pay a lot”
Reviews.Author: Chris20Uk
Reviews.Content: I booked in haste as two nights for three people at Â£102 was too good too miss, then I looked at the reviews! Overall most aspects of past reviews are correct even down to the fire alarm going off on our first night at 2am. Our room was on third floor at the end of the corridor so no passing guests on route to their rooms so relatively quiet although road noise is excessive becomes windows dont close tightly. The bedding and flooring were spotless but the paintwork was dirty and there was a large crack in the wall. Bathroom and towels were clean. Room didnt smell. All carpets in corridors dirty. On the second day a coffee tray appeared in our room which was a pleasant surprise. Breakfast was as expected but stay away from the cereal because they certainly are not a named brand and arrive early otherwise you will have to stand and wait for a table. Overall our stay was ok but i do feel we were relatively lucky. Would we stay again? No but there are so many other places to stay. I do feel however it would have been difficult to beat the value for money so I am not too dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: aifeschariot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, moldy shower heads, plugged up drains, toilet didn't work and had to be fixed upon arrival, torn duvets, holes in the wall. Furthermore the staff is unfriendly and unhelpful. Avoid this hotel! There are better hotels in London for the price in much better locations!

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ksyu
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, just a couple of blocks to Paddington station and Hyde Park. Our first night we were given a room in the basement - it was very shabby, humid and cold, and with a horrible view... and the toilet was wabbly O_o... We asked for another room but had to wait until the next day. The second room we've got was on the fifth floor, it was small but very nice and clean, there was nothing shabby about it. The towels and sheets were very clean and actually like new. I was scared by some reviews that said the hotel had thin walls and was noisy but we didn't hear a sound for all four days we spent there. Maybe we were just lucky to have quiet neighboors, I don't know. The lobby is small but quite nice. The stuff was helpful. Breakfasts were OK - there were 3 kinds of cereals, hot milk, youghurt, ham, cheese, some sauces, bread, buns and croissants, jam and honey, oranges and apples, juice (not quite natural though), and of course tea and coffee. I would definitely stay there again, but of course not in the basement :)

Reviews.Title: “We got the run around!”
Reviews.Author: rleNewEngland
Reviews.Content: I wish I could report on overall hotel but we got the run around. We were booked for one night but were sent to another hotel, a four star, haha. We picked the Royal Eagle for the location to Paddington Station, easy to walk with our luggage, etc. This new hotel was another half mile further from the station. "Oh yes we will pay for a taxi to the station", they said but neither hotel had any clue. It was if the hotels had never heard of each other. I understand the Royal Eagle is being sold so in the future others may not have to deal with them.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: Greatajp
Reviews.Content: Hotel very handy for paddington no problem on check in and room ok though small, bathroom suite could be better made for size Water can stop at peak times so shower late or early Breakfast basic but ok

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, central and problematic”
Reviews.Author: candleberry
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, there isn't much to see in the area but Hyde Park and Paddington station are just a few blocks away. Trains from Heathrow airport go straight to Paddington, which is very convenient. At first, the hotel seemed what we expected of that price range, but our stay in London could have been much more pleasant. The room was small but quite clean. However, some of the towels had large brown stains and emitted white fluff; so after using them you just wanted to take another shower to remove the fluff. There were also some weird stains in some pillow cases. The worst thing about the hotel is that the walls are very very thin - you can hear clearly everything from the corridors and the rooms next to you; the television and normal speaking voices. I guess you could have a nice experience at this hotel if you're lucky to get quiet and considerate neighbours but we ended up missing hours of sleep because other people were up until 3 a.m. talking and making sounds unappropriate for children. If you're a light sleeper, stay away from Royal Eagle. The very loud fire alarm went off twice during our stay, once at 7 a.m., once at 3 a.m., both turned out to be false alarms. Whenever you left the hotel, you had to leave the key to the reception. This meant that the lobby was sometimes full of people waiting for someone to turn up at the desk so that they could get to their rooms. The breakfast was ok, as expected. The hotel has a WiFi connection, but unfortunately the WiFi vouchers are prohibitively expensive. There is a common computer in the lobby area - and if you know anything about computer this helps you to get free WiFi in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, questionable quality.”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyRenee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights. First the perks: the continental breakfast was outstanding and it is quite close to Hyde Park and Paddington Station. Other than that, the room was absolutely miniscule. Even before our baggage was in the room it was impossible to get to the far side of the bed without climbing over. Couldn't pick up shampoo in the shower without bumping your bum, and we are NOT large people. Bedding was musty and did not inspire confidence in its cleanliness. Could hear every noise from out in the hall. Even local calls from the room were astronomically priced. There were about 5 channels on our TV, only 2 of which were in English. And WORST of all, there was a HORRIBLE smell in the bathroom, that all of the bathroom linens had absorbed. I was tempted to just air-dry for fear of it rubbing off on me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money......”
Reviews.Author: MJMChester_UK
Reviews.Content: Ok, you've read some of the horror reviews on here, and no, I'm not an employee or owner of the hotel. Just a normal businessman used to much better hotels and much higher prices. Trawling the net for a hotel for a hotel and came across this one. Could not believe a hotel in fairly central London could be Â£40-Â£45 per night including breakfast. So here I am in my room ready for bed and writing this. What's it REALLY like here? The reception is basic but fine. The bar is very pleasant and clean. The only staff I have spoken to is the receptionist and she was polite and efficient. This hotel is very "spanish friendly..." in that everything is bilingual. It's nice. The reviews on here suggest the rooms are awful.....they aren't. They're ok. Not plush, not dirty, but ok. A little worn at the edges but its clean. The are a little small but I was expecting a matchbox having read some reviews - even the single room is ok. The TV is tiny but so what? No services in the room (tea etc) but for Â£40 I wouldn't expect it. The bathroom is basic - but for Â£40 I expected it to be. Overall - its actually excellent value for money, comfortable, not noisy as suggested and its clean. I like plush like everyone else - so if you are taking your partner to London for a treat don't come here as it's not special. But if you are in town for a few nights and fancy a cheaper hotel - you'll do well to beat this one.

Reviews.Title: “We always come back”
Reviews.Author: Annelin
Reviews.Content: We have tried many hotels in London, but always come back to Royal Eagle. It's so easy to get anywhere, cos Paddington Station is just some minutes away. It's a great area to stay in, lively and friendly. The hotel might not be filled with luxus, and it might smell a little odd here and there. But the staff is always friendly, and when you have been to London often, you know the standard of the hotels is not the highest. Our rooms have always been clean, and not too small either. Compared to other places. We are actually going back both in February and April!

Reviews.Title: “big disappointment KEEP AWAY FROM IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: mimaUK
Reviews.Content: Seriously guys, it was meant to be a good relaxing time with hubby but... First impression. corridor smells. was given a room of 4 for two people (reason was coz they did not have a double bed room for TWO!!!) room was not cosy and quite scary.. the room was TINY, with very annoying stairs in the way..had to squeeze in between the bed and the stairs. now the bathroom.. toilet did not flash, very dirty. the tub was blocked and the shower nozzle was completely out of order splashing water everywhere. hmm what else COLD water. forgot to mention the dirty towels, stained with old mascara, hair and god knows what... this all didnt matter till we went back to sleep and realised the huge window was broken and wind was coming through the curtains, it was absolutely freezing, let alone the noise that can be easily heard from people on the next floor or the adjacent room. Seriously, for the price we could have had a much better night somewhere else. not to recommend at all! good luck hotel hunting. a young couple.

Reviews.Title: “Rising Damp!!!”
Reviews.Author: BoltonJo1
Reviews.Content: Rising Damp....say no more! There are definitely much much better hotels available for the price. Please shop around!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dublinshoe
Reviews.Content: Went to London to celebrate 30th birthday.We were made wait 40 minutes in the reception as the receptionist told us our rooms would be ready in 15 minutes,we asked three times if they were ready and all we got was 'yes in a minute',eventually we left and came back later.Our room was very small and we were not fore warned that the tube ran right underneath our room,needless to say it was very loud.The shower did not turn off properly and the shower curtain did not cover the bath so our bathroom was covered in a few inches of water after about two minutes and it dripped all night.When I told one of the receptionists these things as I checked out all I got was a 'oh right' and that was it.Not impressed at all

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: karelizco
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. I booked a double room, albeit for one person. It was certainly a good job it was for 1 person, 2 wouldnt have fitted in the room, it was tiny. the top blanket was stained (Idont like to think with what!!), the sheets were clean though, so I just took the blanket off. the shower room was clean and great shower. The breakfast was very good, basic but very good. Lots of fresh bread, croissants and hot coffee. Not sure Id stay here again, only because the room was just so small.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, friendly, noisy, small”
Reviews.Author: janecraftNM
Reviews.Content: This place is clean, warm, friendly. The room (a double) was too small for me, a tall person. No view. Ceiling higher than the room is wide. No problems with water in the shower, etc. Shower is about 2 feet square. The hallways are about 2 feet wide and have multiple fire doors. The ones near my room bang shut -- very noisy throughout the night. Very convenient to Paddington station. Breakfast is cold cheese and ham, cereal and yogurt, pastries and toast. Fruit. Coffee, juice, water, milk. Help yourself.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: sugar24
Reviews.Content: We booked in for two nights at the hotel. When we entered the room we though it was a single room (in fact we queried it at reception if we had been given a single room, they said we could change our room, but they were all the same size) one single wardrobe, one bedside table, a table with t.v on it, you couldn't swing a cat in the size of the room. We didn't let it put us off, but when we went into bathroom it was a joke, it was like a cupboard, shower, toilet and wash basin. The shower had mouldy grout, there was no hot water in shower, but scolding in wash basin? Towels where thread bare. All of the floors seem to slant ? Very noisy, I kept thinking somebody had entered our room! Breakfast was average, apart from stale pastries and not very good coffee. It was clean enough but no way would we call it a three star. We checked in for two nights, but even though we complained about shower first night and they said they would get maintanance out, nothing was done about it. When we checked out my husband once again mentioned shower, but all he was interested in was getting the bill done and said we could fill out a comments card

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: lil_osc
Reviews.Content: I have a feeling that most people "knocking" this hotel were expecting the Ritz at a budget price!...ain't gonna happen people! We stayed for 3 nights in a double room on the first floor. The price was very reasonable...on average it worked out to be around Â£70 a night. Yes the room was slightly small BUT more than adequate....unless you're planning on spending all day/night in your room then there is everything you need (tv, bed, wardrobe and en-suite bathroom). We wanted to stay somewhere close to a tube station..we expected to be able to hear/feel the trains..which we did...but in no way did this interrupt our sleep..in fact after a short while you didn't even notice the slight vibrations from the trains...I'm kinda thinking there's been some over exaggerating on the "noise" of the trains....you're a minutes walk from the station people...of course you're going to be able to feel the trains!!! The shower was fantastic..always hot water available and very close to a "power shower" The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was very clean. We arrived early and were able to store our luggage until our room was ready. What can i say about the breakfast?...for a continental breakfast it was as much as you could ask for...everything was fresh...the ham was luvly jubly and the coffee really hit the spot! I'm quite a fussy person and like value for money...we will certainly be using this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “They Are Bloody Thieves”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiArun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was offered to us by Air France. We thought we could trust an International Airline and booked the Hotel as the location was convenient. The rooms and bathrooms are terribly small. It is like you are staying in some slum. We were tourists. The first day we were obviously out the whole day sightseeing. The next day was also the same for us. But this time when we came into our room, my wife felt our bags had been touched. I pooh poohed her and told her IMPOSSIBLE. To our surprise when we checked, the bags were opened and the choicest things were removed. The thief had so much time to go thru each and every thing and removed the most expensive things including my tablet PC, camera etc. To my further shock, when the police came i was told that the same thing had happened on another floor also. The Manager had all sorts of excuses and claimed no responsibility at all. When I enquired, the hotel staff said they did not see anything untoward, nor did they see any person loitering around and also, surprise- the CCTV cameras were on the blink. After I really blew my top, the Manager, promised that he would try and reimburse me through his insurance company. After coming back to India, i called them several times. They would keep me on hold for a long long time and then finally the phone would hang up. But that manager never came on the line or replied to my several emails. I have been wanting to do this for a long long time but never really found the time. But I am again going on a trip to Europe and am relying heavily on others reviews of other Hotels. So I thought, I owe this to my fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: evinne
Reviews.Content: We had lovely weekend in this hotel, it is sad that people write that much of terrible stuff of this lovely hotel. We had a real nicely decorated room with 2 levels, with a huge window almost 3 m high that served as an exit to the balcony. With a nice view to the specific London street. It was a bit small bathroom, but very clean and modern.The breakfast was a bit busy and basic. We were quite happy with it as we dont really have huge breakfasts. I would deffinately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice stay at the fawlty towers =)”
Reviews.Author: Ulla-Bulla
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived to the hotel there was no electricity so we couldnâ€™t check in. Well we thought no problem. We went shopping and came back in the afternoon, we checked in fast with no problems. The staff was nice and friendly. The elevator was broken so we had to take the stairs to our room. And I forgot, the bar is still closed!!! The room was really tiny, like a shoebox, but we thought it was okay since we were not planning to do anything more then sleep anyway! The bathroom was also very tiny; it was a bit of a problem to wipe you after being on the toilet! We didnâ€™t mind about that either! At night it was cold, the windows was shaking and knocking in the wind the entire night, the underground and the traffic, especially the ambulances, was a little disturbing. We fixed the window with a bit of paper and bought ourselves a pajama so the following nights we slept well. The breakfast was good nothing to complain about. Overall we had a nice stay at the Royal Eagle. I could come back again if it wasnÂ´t for the disturbing ambulances and the heavy traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Overall waste of money”
Reviews.Author: intnorth
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to Paddington station. Bad outweighs the good however: cold at night, EXTREMELY noisy corridors creating a lot of disturbance to our sleep during the night and the breakfast was somewhat comical. Would definitely not recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Where Eagles Dare!!!”
Reviews.Author: DarcyLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: After seeing the wonderful pictures of the bedrooms, on the hotel website, we decided that we would book a room at The Royal Eagle Hotel. On arrival there was a sign in the reception area advising that the bar was temporarily closed for the weekend. We then proceeded to our room, which we can only describe as a broom cupboard, i have never been in a hotel room as tiny as this. The double bed was accessable by a narrow gap down one side! It was also very dull & basic. The bathroom was no better, it was mission impossible to get hot water out of the shower & the shower when in use flooded the bathroom! Breakfast was very basic, the restaurant was also very small & could not cater for all of the guests, who had to stand in a line & watch you eat while waiting for a table!! As we were only staying one night we decided to put up with it. l will certainly not use this hotel again & would definately not recommend it to any of my friends! i wish i had read the reviews on this site before my visit!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: italioie
Reviews.Content: We (6) arrived here on Saturday the 3rd at 9am. We requested early check in, when we asked staff about the early check in they had no no information about our request. We understood that this is not always possible so we asked if we could store our suitcases in the storage room to which the receptionist responded "WAIT!" We thought it was quite funny at that moment in time but things got worse. We arrived back to the hotel and staff were extremely rude to us. Nothin is done with a smile they nearly through the keys at us. We went to our rooms and nearly dropped dead with shock. The room was approx 2 1/2 metres x 2 1/2 metres with two single beds sqeezed into the room. It was virtually impossible to get our luggage into the room as the door would not open fully as the beds were too big for the room. Note that the hotel is freezing... i woke up in the middle of the night and had to put a jumper on. The next day i called reception to ask how to turn the heating on he said " do you see the radiator? See the know beside it? TURN IT. Then he hung up the phone. There was 6 of us travelling in total, 3 rooms and every room was tiny! 1 of the rooms had no hot water and when they compained they were told they will have to speak to the manager the next day. This was ok as we had three rooms between us but if this was not the case you would not be able to shower. Safes did not work in any of the rooms. Breakfast was hillarious, toast and cereal with staff staring at your every move. I have never came across such rude people. We were paying money to stay there so didnt expect staff to be like this. I didnt see one staff member smile during our stay. We said please and thank you every time we were dealing with them so we couldn't understand why staff were so bad. The only good point about this hotel is the location, this is the only thing that made our stay bareable. If you decide to choose this hotel whether you get a good deal or not, it's really not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst shower ever!”
Reviews.Author: AngelaCambridge
Reviews.Content: I was unlucky to get a room in the basement--which meant Tube rumblings and street noise. The curtains were very lightweight, so the room got streetlamp light as well. The windows were poor and did nothing to block the noise. Unlike others, I had a good-sized room. In fact, it had three twin beds. It was clean, beds were fine. Also had the laminate wood floor. The hallways were narrow and hard to navigate, with several doors between the elevator and the room. The staff were so-so. The biggest problem was the bathroom/shower. It was not undersize, but there was structural damage to the tub and the shower was horrendous. Extremely hard water pressure so that water pulsed out all over the bathroom no matter what you did. I assume this also had something to do with the hot water running out in about two minutes--though I would think in a hotel, this would not happen. So I didn't get much of a washing, and my hair just got wet when I had to call it quits. Very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “DonÂ´t bother staying at the Royal Eagle”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty_Australia
Reviews.Content: Are you after value for money for your accommodation in London? DonÂ´t waste it at the Royal Eagle then. We stayed at the hotel for two nights and I thanked my lucky stars it was no longer than that. We had a room on the second floor that was sold as a Â´small roomÂ´but really should have been described as a Â´large closetÂ´. Only one person could move about the room at one time and even then it was a tight fit. Not only that, the bathroom didnÂ´t function properly. It was impossible to have a decent shower as the water didnÂ´t drain away. And using the toilet? If youÂ´re short IÂ´m sure itÂ´s fine; however given my husband and I are both tall, we had to straddle the hand basin to be able to use the toilet. On top of this, it was impossible to have a decent night sleep as the window didnÂ´t close properly and Craven Road is very busy right in the early hours of the morning. In short, only stay at the Royal Eagle if you are absolutely desperate for accommodation in Paddington. Paddington is a superb location and there are many better alternatives at a similar price, particularly in Westbourne Terrace and Gloucester Terrace. We paid 77 pounds per night at the Royal Eagle which is defintely far too much to pay for this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel if you need somewhere cheap and cenrtal to stay - No luxuries”
Reviews.Author: Pagazaurtundua
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok and has the minimum you need to spend a night in London. I do think it's well located but that's about it. No luxuries at all. The bathroom was in pretty bad shape. There are nice Asian restaurants around where you can have dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveler5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but very everything has been updated recently. For the price it was a great value. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It was quiet and I didn't hear lots of noise at night and I did not hear the trains at all. I stayed their two nights and was able to leave my baggage in the luggage room. It is a very short walk to Paddington station and Hyde Park where you can catch a tour bus at Marble Arch. They even sell the tickets for the bus tour at the hotel. I had internet access to e-mail home, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The Continental Breakfast was lovely and there was tea, coffee, fresh fruit, pastries and toast with jam along cold meat and cheese . It was a perfect light breakfast to start the day. I would recomend staying here to the traveler on the go.

Reviews.Title: “About as 'comfortable' as a sardine tin”
Reviews.Author: Elvenstar
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a reasonably long train journey expecting a good quality hotel, but what we got was far from that. The website is definately misleading - beware! The foyer looked ok, the staff were helpful enough. Went up to the room in the tiny lift, struggled with luggage through the narrow passage ways and finally reached our room which was situated on the fourth floor. The room was so small I couldnt believe it ! just enough room to get in and squeeze our luggage in. I cannot believe the owners of this hotel actually believe that this is a comfortable stay. The bath room was about 6foot square and thats not exaggerating. EVERYTHING about this hotel is SMALL. The breakfast was poor, not much variety and the tea was awful, I had floaty bits in mine and didnt drink it :( Its very noisy in the evenings , we heard the lift rumbling through the walls, the traffic outside and on one occasion people having sex in the rooms (Loudly) !! There is no London feel about the place, It may as well be in the middle of France or something. No tea or coffee in the rooms which I thought was terrible for a London hotel, although I can't honestly think where a kettle would go considering how small the room is. Very bad design and obvious that all they want is your money. On the upside however, the beds were quite comfortable and the location is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “a very uncomfortable stay - the worse that fawlty towers experience”
Reviews.Author: Spradders
Reviews.Content: This must be the worst hotel we have stayed in. The rooms were tiny with no tea/coffee making facilities. The bar was closed - for refurbishment we could not get a drink of any kind on arrival. The only way to get any refreshments was to go out. The staff were unhelpful and uncommunicative. The coffee at breakfast was cold. It was a nightmare after a long journey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Majla
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with my daughter April 29th-May 2nd and we where really surprised of the high standard and quality for the price. We got a twin bed room on floor 5, with laminate wooden floor. The room was very nice, clean - also the bathroom and spacious. The lobby where relaxing and proper and the staff very friendly and helpful - 24 hrs service. The breakfast room where small, but with white linnen cloths and also very efficient and friendly personnel. We are very happy and very pleased and will certanly recommend this hotel to others. For this price, I think this hotel is a bargin! A hotel in London at this rate is a big risk, and this time we where very lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews below grossly misleading”
Reviews.Author: lmarkes
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel through British Airways, I didn't bother to check the reviews online beforehand. When I read them, I contemplated canceling my trip. It would have been such a mistake! While this 3-star hotel lacks some amenities we are accustomed to in the North American hotels, I find this is the case with ALL European hotels. And, for the price, this little hotel is a true gem. Our room (208) was a decent size. It was very clean. The staff was exceptionally friendly and the breakfast room never crowded. Needless to say, we were not robbed. Even the phone call I made from our room wasn't exorbitantly expensive (less than $1.50 for a 10-minute local call.) So, please don't blindly trust the reviews below. My three-year-old daughter and I enjoyed our stay in London and this hotel definitely helped. The location is awesome, tons of great (and inexpensive) ethnic restaurants nearby. The proximity to Paddington and Heathrow Express trains a definite plus, too.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a chance”
Reviews.Author: werejustwandering
Reviews.Content: My husband selected this hotel out of a range of possibilities offered by British Airways in a crazy package deal before we checked the awful reviews on tripadvisor. So we were prepared to suffer with grace and a sense of humor. But it was great. We stayed in room 413, which WAS tiny, but it was the equivalent of $50 a night. And we only needed a place to rest as the main event was the city outside our window. We also pack light so not having much space to put our things doesn't bother us. Our four-day stay was marked by gracious front desk employees, a clean room every day, and an acceptable free daily continental breakfast. I must say that we are friendly Texans and expect friendliness in return. We are seldom disappointed. Noise did travel easily through our door, but the guests on the fourth floor during our visit were considerate and fairly quiet. If you're on a budget, don't be too quick to dismiss this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: xomega
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on return from New Zealand,before travelling home to our abode.Could'nt wait to check out.We had four beds,there was only two of us (oap's). No help at all,with two heavy large suitcases. At the time,it seemed only one lift was working.On vacating,my husband had to take our cases down via the stairs...
